intro: Neopatersonia falcata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed burr medic, is a perennial herb native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, trifoliate leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and appear in late winter to early spring. Neopatersonia falcata is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils.
